<RESUME_START>
PUBLIC RELATIONS MANAGER

SUMMARY

A growing professional who blends academic training in recreation and sports management with hands on experience in operations, communications, media, and public relations.
With a diverse background in the sports and event industry, I have gained an appreciation of what it means to work hard, manage time and roll with the punches.
As a creative and logical hybrid, I tackle every opportunity with enthusiasm and determination and am always looking for a chance to learn.
Highlights
3.5+ years in sports & event industry Prepared press releases, event highlights, blog posts, media advisories & distributed news through various media channels Generated creative content for official websites, social media platforms, and emails Computer proficient in Apple, Windows, Adobe Photoshop, Cision and Vocus Recipient of Best B2C Marketing Team at the 2014 Utah Marketing Awards

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Recipient of Best B2C Marketing Team at the 2014 Utah Marketing Awards

EXPERIENCE


05/2014 to Current
Public Relations Manager
Company Name
— City , State
Main media contact for The Color Run, The Color Run Night and Electric Run Established mutually beneficial relationships between organization and media, sponsors, charities, and runners Member of creative content team generating copywriting and content for all social media platforms and website Created & distributed press releases, media advisories, and media packets for over 240+ events in North America Set up interviews between staff and media along with training the staff with talking points and FAQ's Updated press page on website, monitored Wikipedia page, and managed press email address Analyzed media coverage and compile comprehensive information about the company for the media

Winter Olympic Games Press Attaché
Company Name
— City , State
* Prepared press releases, event highlights, media advisories, blog posts and distributed news on various media channels * Prepared, posted and maintained content for the official website, social media platforms and membership e-newsletter * Coordinated & facilitated athlete interviews, photo — shoots , video-shoots and appearances with local and national media * Creatively pitched stories to local and national media about athletes and organization * Assisted in creating and implementing fundraising initiatives directed towards membership and community * Main point of contact for media at 2014 Olympic Team Trials and assisted in all phases of planning & execution of the event * Handled all media requests, press conferences, questions, managing victory and event coverage for short track team * Facilitated interview requests between coaches, athletes, staff and the media * Managed relationships between organization and media while working closely with venue management

* Assisted with charity section of official website and Foundation Facebook page * Scheduled and managed volunteers, 50/50 raffle program and silent auction for all home games * Planned and executed team fundraising events including Chicago Fire White Party, Bank of America Chicago Marathon, Fire Brews and Bites and Molly's Cupcake fundraiser

* Planned, promoted and executed the Duke's Kids Club, Reading Wranglers program & team appearances in the community * Planned and executed post-game autograph sessions, watch parties and season ticket holder events * Assisted in merchandising and budgeting by running the team shop both in game and online * Assisted heavily with media relations in producing team game notes and post game notes

08/2001 to 06/2012
Red Rock Raptors U9-U17 Girls Soccer Teams - Assistant Coach

* Prepared documents and filed pleadings in various Nevada courts * Interacted daily with clients to ensure their satisfaction with each case Leadership * Taught the game of soccer by providing technical and tactical skill training 2-3 times per week * Coordinated tournament, game participation and registered team players * Actively participated in all phases of the training, coaching, and preparation of the soccer team * Acted as Head Coach when necessary and as a mentor to young girls

* Assisted with various pre-game and half-time promotions throughout the entire season * Secured pre-game color guard, national anthem singers, walk of champion participants and volunteers * Referee liaison for the 2011 CONCACAF-Gold Cup while also handling referee & team transportation

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Account Executive, Public Relations

Location: Illinois, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Public Relations

Description:
Role Summary:The Senior Account Executive that has a focus on media relations will independently lead $100-299K in retainer accounts or projects. The Senior Account Executive will manage multiple responsibilities including generating consistent media exposure for clients, supporting the development of key themes, campaign strategy, client relations and mentoring other members of the team. Financial experience in public relations is a must have for success in this role.
Responsibilities:Media Relations:Identifies and secures an array of media placements including high-profile and feature opportunities for clients across the teamDelegates tasks and helps with mentoring Account Coordinators, Account Executives, and interns Assists in the development of strategic PR plans and campaign development for team accounts they supportDevelops and maintains relationships with all media outlets including trades, broadcast, and national mediaDevelops unique story angles and timely pitches to generate consistent client exposureClient Service:Independently leads $100-299K in client account revenueServe as lead point of contact and run calls for the client accounts they are leadingDraft PR plans for the accounts they are leadingFunctions as a general point of contact (for clients and internally) for PR initiativesSupports the lead point of contact for other team client accountsParticipates in regular client update calls and meetings as well as new client discovery meetings for other team client accountsWriting:Reviews and edits company-generated content before sharing with clientsSupports in drafting press releases, award nominations, social media posts, and other client-related materials, when neededAdministrative Support:Assists internal team members with other clients, business development, and Company projectsReviews press reports before sending to clientsEnsures that the team has saved final versions to SharePoint and has scheduled press releases for distributionCompany Ambassador:Acts as a steward of the JConnelly brand, consistently representing and reflecting the Company’s core values, approach, and high standards of excellence in all client, media, and public interactions
Performs other duties as assigned
Education: College degree; or equivalent related business experience
Experience & Expertise:Minimum 3-5 years of successful industry-related experience with an emphasis on managing client relationshipsDemonstrated ability to organize/prioritize work, handle details accurately, follow up with minimum supervision, and complete tasks within specified deadlinesExcellent interpersonal, communication, problem-solving, and customer service skillsProficiency with various software applications including the full Office suite, as well as social media channelsProficiency in PR related software including but not limited to Cision, Meltwater, TrendKite, Sprout, Hootsuite, etc.Experience in financial aspects of public relations is required for this role.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
